Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, much of a which has flaked away, is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394652) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394652)
